poem:
"Navigating Stories"

In the muted morning, 
a newspaper blooms errors.
The coral's whispers, not Simpson's,
call their children home.
Warren Ellis, an autumn leaf,
trembles a decade younger. 

Reality, unraveled and rewoven,
is a nourishing confusion.
Every amended article - 
a correction, a clarification,
awake in the painterly light,
blooming in tuneful disorder. 
A canvas of imperfect truths,
painted in ink and whispers.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • An article (The sounds of thriving coral could lure their larvae back to ailing reefs, 13 March, p4) said that Prof Steve Simpson was also involved in the study carried out by Nadège Aoki and her colleagues. In fact, his was a different study on the subject. • The Australian musician Warren Ellis is 59, not 69 (‘We never want to stop!’, 3 April, G2, p9). • Other recently amended articles". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Corrections and clarifications • An article (The sounds of thriving coral could lure their larvae back to ailing reefs, 13 March, p4) said that Prof Steve Simpson was also involved in the study carried out by Nadège Aoki and her colleagues. In fact, his was a different study on the subject. • The Australian musician Warren Ellis is 59, not 69 (‘We never want to stop!’, 3 April, G2, p9). • Other recently amended articles
